message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the problem of minimizing the average of a large number of smooth functions, which is a key problem in training supervised learning models. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper proposes a new variant of the SAGA algorithm, which is a popular optimization algorithm used in machine learning. This falls under the category of numerical analysis (cs.NA). The paper also performs an iteration complexity analysis of the proposed method, which involves the use of stochastic Lyapunov functions. This falls under the category of dynamical systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the convergence rates of the proposed method, which is relevant to the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions the use of the proposed method in computer vision applications, which falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV).
